data.text: Join IMF's Asia+Pacific Department Director @rhee_chang in @ECIPE webinar on "A Protracted Recovery" at 9 a.m. EDT tomorrow. Register here https://t.co/f2v1V20aiN https://t.co/adF9YYpxd6

Compared to our April #WEO, we are now projecting a deeper recession in 2020 and a slower recovery in 2021, but a high degree of uncertainty surrounds this forecast. See the latest projections in #IMFBlog https://t.co/fqM8iURHFv https://t.co/ujnvWm8dYK
9 recommendations to guide bank supervisors in their response to the pandemic in our latest #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/aijy1pLVXr https://t.co/9XXLbqjBl6

Sub-Saharan Africa is racing to close the global digital divide. Internet penetration in the region has grown tenfold since the early 2000s, compared with a threefold increase in the rest of the world. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #DigitalAfrica #IMFCountryFocus

The #COVID19 pandemic has had a more negative impact on activity in the first half of 2020 than anticipated. Global growth is now projected at –4.9% in 2020, 1.9 percentage points below our April 2020 #WEO. Read the latest report https://t.co/WpXSzg9YxA https://t.co/HjZ0IMdf2j
The IMF is fully committed to supporting our member countries, particularly the most vulnerable. Learn more here https://t.co/YjjfFMBey5 #COVID19 https://t.co/c26CSXwhCb
The #pandemic has put the brakes on #migration, but economies depend on #migrants in many ways. Listen to the @imf_podcast https://t.co/cfzdo6z4N8 https://t.co/8x1qAHkhQE

#Sweden’s milder containment strategy may have moderated the economic fallout at the beginning of the crisis, but the length and the depth of the recession will be driven by multiple factors. #COVID19 #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/4lb3WCQxw1 https://t.co/JE2JmaUBZw

The IMF is providing emergency financial assistance and debt relief to member countries facing the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. Find out which have so far received emergency financial assistance: https://t.co/lJlAHDqkKl https://t.co/LnuvMBpk6L

For #PacificIsland countries, the #COVID19 pandemic may inflict deeper economic wounds than even the worst natural disaster. Find out more https://t.co/zYc3ucFnX6 #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/PqWGT92QVH

The #COVID19 pandemic pushed economies into a #GreatLockdown, which helped contain the virus and save lives, but also triggered the worst recession since the Great Depression. Read @GitaGopinath’s #IMFBlog on the #WEO https://t.co/fqM8iURHFv https://t.co/twj1P9ru2o

How is your country protecting the economy, jobs and people during the #COVID19 pandemic? Find out in our UPDATED policy tracker, where key economic responses for 193 countries are available: https://t.co/NxU7Gg8jr4 https://t.co/ka2092Tz67

A recent poll of top economists found that the vast majority felt the #COVID19 pandemic will worsen inequality, in part through its disproportionate impact on low-skilled workers. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA

The #COVID19 impact is set to wipe out several years of income gains in sub-Saharan Africa. Real per capita GDP in the region is projected to contract by 5.4% in 2020. https://t.co/5p1NODrdhy #IMFAfrica https://t.co/NXM6WPRrJA

The digital divide—the gap between those who have Internet access and those who don’t—is more like a chasm. How does your country measure up? #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/hjrGxmsner https://t.co/JwcbsGy4E0

Like many tourism-dependent countries, #Montenegro has been hit hard from the effects of #COVID19. Read #IMFCountryFocus to find out how Montenegro is combating the impact of COVID-19: https://t.co/s2zmiPXVnM

What are the measures taken by #Uganda to enhance transparency and governance in the use of the $491.5 million IMF emergency financing? https://t.co/AV0P6GsRlA #IMFAfrica #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/8TfCGMHqpS

Women have borne the brunt of the economic disruption caused by #COVID19. At times of crisis, gender balanced leadership becomes even more important to avoid measures that disproportionately impact women. #IMFGender https://t.co/lmH04D3syp https://t.co/uXpO91i3H0

Political economy plays an incredibly important role in our search to explain why things are working or not. This issue of F&D magazine explores economic policymaking and politics in light of the global pandemic. https://t.co/Uj7S2MYDAB #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/jqwFtg3TKh

IMF's Sayeh at #Fin4Dev Roundtable: Countries around the world face multiple shocks and need urgent financing. The IMF has responded on an unprecedented scale – disbursing  $25 billion of emergency financing to 72 countries to help protect the lives and livelihoods of people. https://t.co/CxJXuk6nQ6

For the first time in living memory, #Asia’s growth is expected to contract by 1.6 percent—a downgrade of our April projection. Read what’s happening to Asia’s economy: https://t.co/Cj5gk8jGuU #IMFBlog
How #Paraguay defeated #COVID19 and is betting on public investment and governance reforms to boost growth. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/PSBXX9v4Qk https://t.co/K6onvNhNOo
The #Internet remains a luxury: half of the world’s population does not have access. Read #IMFBlog to dive into the facts & figures #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/hjrGxmsner https://t.co/rs9AdX2KlC

Growth in #EmergingMarket and developing economies is forecast at –3.0% in 2020, 2 percentage points below the April 2020 #WEO forecast. For low-income developing countries, it is projected at –1.0%, some 1.4 percentage points below April. https://t.co/WpXSzg9YxA https://t.co/PPfm9HOqaq

Our latest research shows that digital finance is associated with higher GDP growth and financial inclusion. It could therefore play an important role in mitigating the economic and social impact of the ongoing #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/BIL0De7gRX #fintech
What economic measures are governments taking to respond to #COVID19? Key actions taken by 193 countries are listed in our Policy Tracker: https://t.co/hDP0Gi0i7n https://t.co/TsTLE0xUKy

Governments today face difficult policy decisions due to #COVID19. Strong economic foundations and technical know-how can help them design and implement necessary policies for a resilient recovery. https://t.co/Ah8mgrUP2a #IMFBlog #IMFCapDev @imfcapdev https://t.co/afcdbbhYJU
Food security in #Africa is under threat. #ClimateChange and epidemics are making it worse. On the #IMFBlog, we discuss 4 critical things governments can do. https://t.co/3q8xZEchVO #IMFAfrica

#COVID19 is causing a strong recession in #Vietnam this year. However, the economic impact is expected to be milder than in most countries in Asia and tentative signs of a domestic recovery can already be seen. Find out how Vietnam did it: https://t.co/3ESnGlzG1i #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/yPFkyfXwC2

A disconnect between financial markets and the real economy has emerged with the pandemic, posing a risk to the recovery should investors’ attitude change and cause a correction. Read our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/ABEsjgYcpy  #GFSR https://t.co/UnB1I30huA

The IMF is fully committed to supporting its member countries during the #COVID19 outbreak. Learn more about the IMF's work to address this global challenge here: https://t.co/MmAtAVRwus https://t.co/8CXJqABOns

The IMF has taken decisive action to help countries, large and small, fight the #COVID19 economic crisis with the creation of a new Short-term Liquidity Line. This facility further strengthens the global financial safety net to tackle the crisis. https://t.co/nRW9GRx7Fi #IMFBlog https://t.co/3QS0d8Fdeq

To fight the crisis, #LatAm needs to spend limited fiscal resources wisely. To prop up economic activity and avoid long-term damage, countries can help companies stay afloat and keep their employees with financing and payroll support. #IMFBlog https://t.co/MX33AoVErL https://t.co/9nsESHQ13D

The #COVID19 pandemic has had a more negative impact than anticipated, and the recovery is projected to be more gradual amidst a lot of uncertainty. What can countries do? #WEO https://t.co/WpXSzfSn90 https://t.co/fExrVUBzTZ
What are the measures taken by #Nigeria to enhance transparency and governance in the use of the $3.4 billion IMF emergency financing? https://t.co/0zqIbYHz5U #IMFAfrica https://t.co/P0UScB3W2P

New research shows that greater access to #finance & #technology is associated with higher intergenerational income mobility. Learn how governments can harness the power of financial technology in the #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva: https://t.co/dr0meoljJe https://t.co/RtiD3jW7xZ

#Kurzarbeit, #Germany's short-time work scheme, was instrumental in keeping employment stable during the global financial crisis. But this crisis is likely to be even more profound. Will this program be as effective this time around? #COVID19 https://t.co/1xFvAdbDL6 https://t.co/yian2mbJ1s
With 300+ confirmed cases of #COVID19 and no deaths, #Vietnam is already seeing signs of an economic recovery. Listen to the latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/38pU99JNEh https://t.co/Ruy1SWaBW5

The IMF expects a contraction of 9.4% in #LatAm and #Caribbean this year—the region’s largest recession on record. As the pandemic subsides, a partial recovery of 3.7% is forecast for 2021. https://t.co/nZLno3PT7F #IMFBlog https://t.co/53ISqS4O9M

The #COVID19 impact is set to wipe out several years of income gains in sub-Saharan Africa. Real per capita GDP in the region is projected to contract by 5.4% in 2020. https://t.co/5p1NODrdhy #IMFAfrica https://t.co/ixS91qPoln
We project #Asia’s economic output in 2022 to be about 5 percent lower compared with the level predicted before the crisis. Read the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/cLBDWHIHXQ https://t.co/6YA4Mnt73g

The latest IMF #WeekendRead newsletter focuses on the state of the global economy, regional economic outlooks, lessons from Vietnam on tackling COVID-19, new opportunities for digital financial inclusion and much more. Read and subscribe here: https://t.co/LLdk780dWq https://t.co/XMWNwhoEyE

IMF's Rhee: To address increasing inequality in #Asia, access to health and basic services should be broadened, and social safety nets should be expanded to extend unemployment insurance coverage to informal workers. Read the blog: https://t.co/xi1YABNr7D @yicaichina https://t.co/6o9U092U48

Our new research shows how past pandemics led to higher income inequality and hurt employment prospects of those with limited education. These effects are likely to be exacerbated in Asia due to the large proportion of informal workers. Read the analysis: https://t.co/WwPuaDVw2i https://t.co/iLG5zqxdAv

Economic activity in sub-Saharan #Africa this year is now projected to decline by 3.2% – double the contraction anticipated in April. More in our latest Regional Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan Africa: https://t.co/5p1NODrdhy #IMFAfrica https://t.co/V9LbtPQIF3

#COVID19 has disrupted tourism and trade, and cut remittances to pacific island countries. Learn more about how the IMF is helping countries weather the crisis. https://t.co/zYc3ucWYOE #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/XcZAHcDGva

In response to #COVID19, the IMF has approved US$5.5 billion in emergency financing to 17 countries in LatAm & Caribbean in addition to new Flexible Credit Lines to Chile & Peru, & the renewal of Colombia’s FCL, expanding our precautionary lending to the region to US$107 billion. https://t.co/n2l8h8TrMX
